ARABIC: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When the single blast is sounded on the trumpet,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: With the first blast of sound from the trumpet,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when the Trumpet will be blown, with a sudden single blow.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when the trumpet is blown with a single blast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So, when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when the trumpet shall sound one blast
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When a single blast is blown on the trumpet,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when the Trumpet shall sound a single blast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then, when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blowing (the first one),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When a single blow is blown on the Horn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then, when the Trumpet is sounded a single time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:13] Thus when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast, to [announce] the passing of judgement upon all creatures — this being the second [blast] —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when the trumpet shall sound one blast) which will not be repeated; this is the blast of the Resurrection.
